Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice with cul and handle root; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with two added white bands; exterior: two dilute lines at junction with cul; below, on left, handle root outlined in dark brown; on right, two vertical dilute lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The paper label is glued to the interior surface with the number 29 written in pencil; it is also written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0925) (phase 2)
